title: Mission Uniforms
description: The Player Mission system has the primary function for ingame quests with the intention of guiding new players in how to play Sins 2. Largely these take the form of 'Do X->Get Y Reward->Repeat'. The uniform file that this schema governs defines those missions, their order, and certain parts of the ingame HUD.

game_state.description: Localized text to show player what game phase they are in.

game_state_tooltip_description.description: Description for the game phase tooltip.

icon.description: Just the icon for the mission trigger tooltip.

main_mission_chains.description: These act as game phases. Early game operations, mid-game, etc.

advance_id.description: What main mission to advance to after this is complete.

operation_chains.description: Array of operation lines within a main phase.

home_planet_track.description: Planet track to be increased at homeworld

is_last_mission.description: When true, the player will advance out of the operation chain when completing this mission.

is_main_chain_end.description: Completing this mission treats this game phase as complete, and moves on when this is true.

main_chain_advance_id.description: Used with is_main_chain_end. The player will move to this chain on completion.

operation_advance_id.description: Used with is_main_chain_end. The player will move to this operation, within the chain set by main_chain_advance_id on completion.

passthrough_enabled.description: When true, if the player may already fill the conditions for completion, it's skipped.

send_to_side_operations.description: When true, the player will be shoved into this game phases' side operations.
